DOC.detailed_description: The purpose pilot study find receive electronic health information ( e.g . text message Facebook post ) pregnancy change pregnant teen think prenatal health fetal maternal health outcome improve . This study aim : 1 . Assess impact provide health information pregnant adolescent ( Facebook text message ) fetal maternal health outcome across pregnancy . 2 . Assess maternal nutrition knowledge use brief questionnaire social medium intervention . 3 . Evaluate adolescent belief , attitude influence dietary , physical activity , life choice ask teen participate interview focus group . 4 . Evaluate adolescent belief , attitude influence dietary , physical activity life choice perspective healthcare provider interview allied health worker adolescent pregnancy clinic .
DOC.criteria: English speaking pregnant adolescent enrol `` Vitamin D Status Impacts Inflammation Risk Infections Pregnancy '' study ( Clinical Trials ID : NCT01815047 ) indicate interest consent form participate additional study eligible participate study . In order participate , adolescent agree contacted future study . Adolescents < 18 , carry single fetus 1230 week gestation eligible participate study . Healthcare provider ( > 18 ) work adolescent maternity clinic interact pregnant adolescent eligible participate study . This would include nurse , midwife , nutritionist , physician , social worker age gender . Exclusion criterion study include adolescent male female pregnant speak English . Additionally , adolescent participant exclude diagnosed eating disorder , malabsorption disease , HIV infection , diabetes ( criterion outline parent study protocol ; Clinical Trials ID : NCT01815047 ) Healthcare providers speak English eligible participate study .
